sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg:
Die Bedienerin sucht noch 100 Kronen zu er-
pressen: Frau Müller hat gesagt 500 Kronen! Ich verweigere sie u. weise darauf hin, daß Frau M. paar Tage nach dem ersten gekommen ist.
An Frau Kluge (Br.): erklären uns bereit, einige Möbel zu kaufen.

The maid tries to blackmail us for
another 100 Kronen: Mrs. Müller says 500 Kronen! I refuse her these and point out that Mrs. Müller arrived a few days after the first of the month.
To Mrs. Kluge (letter): declaring ourselves prepared to purchase several pieces of furniture.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Hertzka (K.): urgire das 1. Heft.
To Hertzka (postcard): I ask him to hurry up with the first volume.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: 10½h in den botanischen Garten: sichtlich bessere Arbeit u. Aufschwung; sehen den ersten Schmetterling.
Bei Turetzky starke Erhöhung.
Bei Jetty; Abschied vom Major, der nach Wels geht.
Linien zu Mozart Schenker, "Mozart: Sonate A-moll," in: Der Tonwille, Heft 2 (1921), 22–24; Eng. trans., vol. I, 69–71. fertiggestellt.
At 10:30 in the Botanical Garden: obviously better work and an improvement; see the first butterflies.
At Turetzky's steep price increase.
At Jetty's; farewells to Major, who is going to Wels.
Urlinien for Mozart completed.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lie-Liechen besorgt Brot, Tabakfassung u. dann geht es nach Hütteldorf – Weidlingau; der Park leider geschlossen; pflücken Primeln!
Heini bringt abends 1 kg Butter.
Brotteig.
Lie-Liechen procures bread, tobacco ration form and then off we go to Hütteldorf – Weidlingau; unfortunately the park is closed; pluck auriculas!
In the evening Heini brings one kilo of butter.
Bread dough.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von U. E. (Br.): = OC 52/254, April 1, 1921, from Alfred Kalmus. Cliches Cliches: lit. "printing blocks", as used in Tonwille for the music examples interspersed within the text; Schenker presumably means proofs pulled from these. zur V. u. Bach; Einladung zur Besprechung wegen einer Stelle aus der Literatur zu op. 101.
Caféhaus.
Mit Jetty u. Major zu Gerngroß; Rohseide zu einer Weste: 770 Kronen.
Die Jause bei Jetty genommen.
From UE (letter): engraved music examples for the Fifth Symphony and Bach E-flat-minor Prelude; invitation to discuss a passage in the "Secondary Literature" section of Op. 101.
Coffee-house.
With Jetty and Major to Gerngroß; Raw silk for a waistcoat: 770 Kronen.
Tea at Jetty's.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Aus Galtür (Br.): Bereiterklärung; Preis 200 – 250 Kronen.

Ins Archiv; Wizewa; = OC 52/254, April 1, 1921, from Alfred Kalmus. Jahn, III. Aufl. Cliches: lit. "printing blocks", as used in Tonwille for the music examples interspersed within the text; Schenker presumably means proofs pulled from these. u. Allg. Musikzeitung von 1810 – Hoffmann – eingesehen.
Telegramm nach Galtür 28.50 Kronen: bestelle Zimmer; Wiederholung der Bestellung in einer Karte.
From Galtür (letter): explaining availability; price 200–250 Kronen.
To the Archive; Wizewa; Jahn, third edition and Allgemeine Musikzeitung from 1810 – Hoffmann – looked into it.
Telegram to Galtür 28.50 Kronen: order room; repeat the order in a postcard.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Dahms (Br.): = OJ 10/1, [62], April 4, 1921. bittet um Fürsprache bei Cotta wegen eines Büchleins über die italienische Oper.
Von Gärtner (K.): meldet die Ankunft des Bruders für nächsten Monat.
Vergeblicher Versuch, Hertzka telefonisch zu erreichen.
Lie-Liechen nicht wohl.
From Dahms (letter): requests an intercession with Cotta regarding a little book about Italian opera.
From Gärtner (postcard): announces the arrival of his brother next month.
Futile attempt to reach Hertzka by telephone.
Lie-Liechen not well.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg:
½5h bei Hertzka: „Mit wirklicher Beklommenheit, Meister“ fängt er an! Nur heraus, sage ich. „Um Bekker geht es! Wir sind befreundet, er mein Gast so oft er hier-
her kommt, ich dort der seine; es ist mir peinlich, daß er sozusagen in meinem Hause so beleidigt werden soll.“ Ich, kurz: höchst einfach, den Uebersatz in den Tonwillen. Darauf Hertzka: „Wenn er schon gehenkt werden soll, so zumindest nicht in meinem Hause!“

tei:div.tei:opener: 8 Nice, cool; eclipse of the sun!

tei:ab.tei:seg:
At 4:30 at Hertzka's: he begins by saying "With true trepidation, maestro!" Out with it, I reply. "It's about Bekker! We're friends, he's my guest whenever he comes here,
and I'm his when I'm there; it's embarrassing to me that he should be so insulted, so to speak, in my house." I reply, succinctly: it's quite simple, the type overrun in the Tonwille. To which Hertzka answers: "If he's going to be hanged, at least not in my house!"

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Frau Schloss (Br.): empfehle Seefeld.
Nach Tisch bei Jetty.
Abends Lie-Liechen aus Jahn Mozart-Briefe vorgelesen.
To Mrs. Schloss (letter): recommend Seefeld.
After lunch to Jetty's.
In the evening read Lie-Liechen Mozart letters from Jahn.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: um 10h nach Hütteldorf; – Weidlingau gegessen, dann Café im „Waldandacht“; per Bahn nachhause.
at 10:00 to Hütteldorf; – Ate in Weidlingau, then coffee at "Waldandacht"; home by train .

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Sophie (Br.): hofft im Mai zu kommen.
Brotteig.

Mit Lie-Liechen ins Archiv: sie schreibt Hoffmann, E. T. A. Hoffmann's unsigned review, "Sinfonie pour 2 Violons … par Beethoven," in: Allgemeine musikalische Zeitung 12 (1809/10), cols 630–42, 650–59, material from which Schenker quoted and discussed in his article "Beethoven: V. Sinfonie," in: Der Tonwille, Heft 5 (1923), 15–17; Heft 6 (1923), 31–32; Eng. trans., vol. I, 186–87, vol. II, 26 (cf. entry for April 6. ich an den Scarlatti-Sammlungen; zu meiner Ueberraschung finde ich Brahms’ Handexemplar mit seinen Notizen in Czernys Ausgabe; nehme sie mit nachhause.
From Sophie (letter): hopes to come in May.
Bread dough.

With Lie-Liechen to the Archive: she writes down Hoffmann, while I am over at the Scarlatti collection; to my surprise I find Brahms's personal copy of the Czerny edition with his annotations; I take them home with me.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lie-Liechen nach Tisch zu mir wegen der Pflanzen usw.
An Dahms (Br.): sage Brief an Cotta zu u. berichte über die neuesten U. E.-Ereignisse.
An Vrieslander (K.): mit der selben Meldung.
An Hertzka (K.): dringe auf Heft u. Sonate, damit ich den Sommer über rasten kann.
An Cotta (Br.): = CA 202, April 12, 1921. empfehle Dahms Büchlein.
Lie-Liechen after lunch to my place on account of the plants etc.
To Dahms (letter): promise a letter to Cotta and report on the latest UE events.
To Vrieslander (postcard): with the same content.
To Hertzka (postcard): urging publication of the issue and the sonata, so that I can rest over the Summer .
To Cotta (letter): I recommend Dahm's little book.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Ins Archiv wegen Müller-Reuter. Frau Dr. Kraus gibt die Auskunft: Es ist ja sehr vernünftig, Brahms dem offentlichen Verkehr zu übergeben.
Caféhaus.
To the Archive on account of Müller-Reuter. Dr. Kraus's wife gives me the advice that it is very sensible to expose Brahms to publicity.
Coffee-house.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Bei Lie-Liechen Zeitungsrückstände von 1914 zur Hälfte geordnet.
At Lie-Liechen's sorted out half the old newspapers dating from 1914 onwards.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:div.tei:opener: 15. Regen – endlich seit langem der erste.

tei:ab.tei:seg: Vormittag, nach Tisch u. abends die alten Zeitungen völlig in Ordnung gebracht.
Frl. Pechaček bringt das weiße Kleidchen (aus zwei alten Unterröcken gearbeitet) 1530 Kronen.

tei:div.tei:opener: 15 Rain – at last, the first in a long time.

tei:ab.tei:seg: In the morning, after lunch and in the evening finished sorting out the old newspapers.
Miss Pechaček brings the little white dress (made from two old petticoats) 1,530 Kronen.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Frl. Fried Karte aus Florenz.
Lie-Liechen verkauft Papier, 54 kg: 540 Kronen.
Jettys Rechnung mit 639 Kronen beglichen.

Von Roth
durch Hupka vier Händelkonzerte u. Brief.
From Miss Fried postcard from Florence.
Lie-Liechen sells paper, 54 kilos: 540 Kronen.
Settled Jetty's invoice with 639 Kronen.

From Roth
via Hupka four concertos by Handel and letter.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lie-Liechen zu mir.
Heini bringt abends Butter.
Lie-Liechen to my place.
Heini brings butter in the evening.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von U. E. (K.): = OC 52/255, April 15, 1921, from Alfred Kalmus. kündigt Erscheinen des 1. Heftes, op. 101 u. op. 2 No. 1 Schenker, "Beethoven: opus 2 Nr. 1," in: Der Tonwille, Heft 2 (1921), 25–48; Eng. trans., vol. I, pp. 72–95. an; wirklich ausgegeben op. 111 der Gesamtausgabe.
Brahms – Scarlatti zurückgestellt; 3 Bände Mannheimer Sinfonie u. Kammermusik nachhause.
Abends läßt Herr Hasenörl fragen, ob er morgen um ½4h vorsprechen darf.
From UE (postcard): announces publication of the first issue, Op. 101 and Op. 2 No. 1; in reality, they have published Op. 111 of the complete edition.
Brahms–Scarlatti returned; home with three volumes of the Mannheim symphonic and chamber music.
In the evening Mr. Hasenörl sends someone to ask whether he may call on me at 3:30 tomorrow.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Hupka erwartet mich um 12h; wegen eines Briefes an Furtwängler, um sich ihm in Erinnerung zu bringen; auch Weisse erwartet uns.
Caféhaus.
4–5h Hasenörl sucht seine Lage zu verbessern, offenbar um Frl. Dolfi heiraten zu können; ich empfehle ihm, Foll aufzusuchen u. sage zu, bei Gelegenheit Hertzka zu sprechen.
Denkmäler zuende.
Hupka expects me at 12 noon; because of a letter to Furtwängler, so that the latter may remember who he is; also Weisse is expecting us.
Coffee-house.
4:00–5:00 Hasenörl seeks to improve his lot, obviously so as to be able to marry Miss Dolfi; I recommend that he look up Foll and consent to speak to Hertzka at the next opportunity.
Finished Denkmäler.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lie-Liechen mit der Bedienerin auf dem Boden, holen Kisten; Beginn des Büchereinpackens.
Ins Archiv: Müller-Studie abgeschlossen u. entliehen Bd. I der Haydn-Sonaten u. Sinfonien.
Bamberger bringt ein Exemplar von Schuberts Hmoll-Sinfonie aus dem Archiv; es stellt sich heraus, daß es aus Brahms Nachlass stammt.
Klammerth verspricht Sommerwohnung bei Braunau.
Lie-Liechen is in the attic with the maid, fetching crates; beginning of book-packing.
To the Archive: Müller study completed, and first volume of the Haydn sonatas and symphonies borrowed.
Bamberger brings out a copy of Schubert's B-minor Symphony from the Archive; it transpires that it is from Brahms's Nachlass.
Klammerth promises a summer apartment near Braunau.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Der Trödler holt die „Musik“ vom 2. bis zum vorletzten Heft: 880 Kronen.
Von U. E.: erstes Heft umbrochen u. op. 2 No. 1. Schenker, "Beethoven: opus 2 Nr. 1," in: Der Tonwille, Heft 2 (1921), 25–48; Eng. trans., vol. I, pp. 72–95.
Caféhaus.
Konzert Furtwängler: Braunfels Variationen u. Berlioz, Schubert Hmoll u. Oberon Ouvertüre.
Brahms Notizen in mein Exemplar aufgenommen.
The second-hand dealer picks up Die Musik from the second to the last issue but one: 880 Kronen.
From UE: first issue in page-proofs and Op. 2, No. 1.
Coffee-house.
Furtwängler concert: Braunfels Variations and Berlioz, Schubert B minor and Oberon Overture.
Have copied Brahms's annotations into my copy.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: 8½h Herr Hauser in Vertretung Neuwirths bei Lie-Liechen: belügt sie, um Aufschub zu erreichen.
Ins Archiv: Mannheimer zurück.
Lie-Liechen zu Dr. Schulz.
Nach Tisch Keilgasse 8, wo wir nähere Details der Umtriebe u. Lügen erfahren.
Diktat zum 2. Heft begonnen.
8:30 Mr. Hauser representing Neuwirth at Lie-Liechen's: tells her lies, in order to obtain a postponement.
To the Archive: Mannheim returned.
Lie-Liechen to Dr. Schulz's.
After lunch No. 8 Keilgasse, where we learn more details about the intrigues and lies.
Dictation for the second issue begun.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Fl. (K.): teilt von einer sonderbaren Konzertabsage an jüdische Hochschüler mit.
Zu Kletschka, um ihn die Umbtriebe der Freunde Neuwirths zu erzählen; er: schicken Sie mir die Hausbesorgerin.
Frau Willmann meint, es sei nicht notwendig.
Bei Jetty.
Von Gärtner (K.): Ernst sei gekommen.
Hupka über den Schaden aufgeklärt, den er durch vorzeitiges Auftreten unter Furtwängler erlitte.
From Floriz (postcard): informs us about a peculiar concert cancellation regarding Jewish highschool students.
To Kletschka, to tell him about the intrigues of Neuwirth's friends; he replies: send me the lady concierge.
Mrs. Willmann opines that that will not be necessary.
At Jetty's.
From Gärtner (postcard): Ernst has arrived.
I explain to Hupka the damages he would incur through a premature appearance under Furtwängler.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Ernst Gärtner (Visitenk.): Begrüßung, Raucherkarte beigelegt.
9¼h zur Sympathie-Kundgebung für Tirol ins Rathaus: auffallend geringe Teilnahme, schlechte Redner.
Gegessen im Gasthaus „zur Stadt Brünn“.
Caféhaus.
Nach der Jause Lie-Liechen bei mir, bereitet für den Lackierer vor, packt ein bis abends.
Diktat Riemann nach Thayer.
To Ernst Gärtner (visiting card): greetings, smoker card included.
9:15 to the town hall for the demonstration sympathizing with the Tyrol with noticeably poor attendance, bad speakers.
Eat at the restaurant "zur Stadt Brünn".
Coffee-house.
After teatime Lie-Liechen at my place, preparing for the lacquerer, packing until evening .
Dictate Riemann according to Thayer.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Frieda (Ansichtsk.): Grüße.
Bamberger verspricht den Möbelwagen, überbringt von Furtwängler die Einladung für Donnerstag oder Freitag abends; bestimme Donnerstag im Café Vindobona.
From Frieda (picture postcard) greetings.
Bamberger promises the furniture truck, brings the invitation for Thursday or Friday evening from Furtwängler; I decide on Thursday in Café Vindobona.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Lie-Liechen schickt 5 Karten an Köchinnen.
Nach Tisch packt sie Bücher ein, Jetty reibt das Schuhschränkchen aus; Café bei mir; Lackierer u. Rahmenmacher holen pünktlich die Sachen ab.
Ein Wedel fehlt.
Lie-Liechen packt bis 6½h.
Lie-Liechen sends five postcards to lady cooks.
After lunch she packs books, Jetty cleans out the shoe cupboard; coffee at my apartment; the lacquerer and the frame maker fetch the items punctually.
A feather duster is missing.
Lie-Liechen packs until 6:30.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Frau Loibl: „Der Wed’l is aus ’m Leim gangen“ – will ihn „ersetzen“.
Nachmittag Keilgasse; der Sohn meint plötzlich, Frau Kluge gedenkt nicht auszuziehen, was uns überrascht.
Caféhaus.
Bamberger richtet noch einmal die Bereitwilligkeit des Vaters aus.
Mrs. Loibl: "The feather duster has gone bust" – wants to "replace" it.
Afternoon Keilgasse; suddenly the son is of the opinion that Mrs. Kluge is not thinking of moving out, which surprises us.
Coffee-house.
Once again Bamberger reports the readiness of his father.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD
sdo:itemDesc.dc:description: A summary of the contents of the record (currently unused)
sdo:itemDesc.dc:subject: A list of subjects (currently unused)

tei:ab.tei:seg: Tausche mit Frl. Elias die Konzertkarten.
Abends mit Furtwängler; lesen ihm einiges aus dem 1. Heft vor, zeige Brahms’ Notizen zur Schubert Sinfonie.
Exchange concert tickets with Miss Elias.
In the evening with Furtwängler; read him some bits aloud from the first issue, show him Brahms's annotations for the Schubert symphony.

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921
sdo:itemDesc.dcterms:dateSubmitted: The Date of Electronic Creation Goes Here: YYYY-MM-DD

tei:ab.tei:seg: An Fl. (K.): = OJ 8/4, [5], April 29, 1921. über die jüngsten Ereignisse.
Lie-Liechen packt nach der Jause weiter.
Mit Brünauer politische Unterhaltung: will nie gegen die Deutschen gewesen sein, habe es genau so gemeint, wie ich!
To Floriz (postcard): about the most recent events.
After teatime Lie-Liechen continues to pack.
With Brünauer political conversation: was never against the Germans, and meant it the same way as I did!

sdo:itemDesc.dc:title: Diary entry by Schenker April, 1921

tei:ab.tei:seg: Von Dr. Epstein (Br.): warnt uns einzuziehen.
Lie-Liechen zu Dr. Schulz u. dann in die Schmidtgasse, sowohl vor- wie nachmittags, leider Giebl nicht angetroffen.
Bei Jetty Auseinandersetzung über das Thema: Vorsicht.
From Dr. Epstein (letter): warning us to move in.
Lie-Liechen to Dr. Schulz and then to the Schmidtgasse, both in the morning and in the afternoon, but unfortunately did not find Giebl in.
At Jetty's altercation about the subject: cautiousness.
